meanings.definition: In a manner relating to reproduction.
meanings.sent1: The birds sang reproductively in the early morning, signaling the start of mating season.
meanings.sent2: The cells divide reproductively to create new life.
meanings.sent3: The flowers bloomed reproductively, attracting bees with their sweet nectar.
meanings.sent4: The ideas spread reproductively throughout the community, sparking new innovations.
meanings.sent5: The fish spawned reproductively, filling the river with their offspring.

meanings.sent1: The healthy animals are reproductively active and can produce offspring.
meanings.sent2: The plant is reproductively mature and ready to pollinate.
meanings.sent3: The insects are reproductively successful, ensuring the survival of their species.
meanings.sent4: The bacteria are reproductively efficient, multiplying rapidly in the right conditions.
meanings.sent5: The mammals are reproductively fertile, able to bear young regularly.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the process of reproduction.
meanings.sent1: The reproductively complex system ensures the continuation of the species.
meanings.sent2: The reproductively active animals engage in courtship rituals.
meanings.sent3: The reproductively advanced technology allows for genetic modifications.
meanings.sent4: The reproductively intricate dance of the bees ensures pollination.
meanings.sent5: The reproductively vital organs play a crucial role in the life cycle.
